customer_addr:
272 PICKLE HILL ROAD
FORT PLAIN, NY 13339

citations.narrative:
1. A hole was observed in the wooden floor in an enclosure housing 2 dogs. This could lead to injury since the hole was
large enough to allow the dogs' legs to fall through. Enclosures must be kept in good repair to avoid injury to the animals.
****Correct by April 1, 2021
2. A piece of wood serving as a support beam in one enclosure was observed with worn jagged edges. In addition, the
tips of 2 screws were exposed and facing into the enclosure. This condition could injure the dogs. The enclosure needs to
be kept in good repair in order to protect the dogs from injury. The screws were removed and this was corrected at the
time of inspection.
*******Corrected at time of inspection

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Some food bowls were observed with an accumulation of debris. Feeding out of unsanitary bowls could cause the dogs to
become ill and affect their health. Food receptacles must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks.
*****Correct by March 22, 2021
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
3.6(a)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
1. A hole was observed in the wooden floor in an enclosure housing 2 dogs.  This could lead to injury since the hole was 
large enough to allow the dogs' legs to fall through. Enclosures must be kept in good repair to avoid injury to the animals. 
****Correct by April 1, 2021 
2. A piece of wood serving as a support beam in one enclosure was observed with worn jagged edges. In addition, the 
tips of 2 screws were exposed and facing into the enclosure. This condition could injure the dogs. The enclosure needs to 
be kept in good repair in order to protect the dogs from injury. The screws were removed and this was corrected at the 
time of inspection. 
*******Corrected at time of inspection 
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Some food bowls were observed with an accumulation of debris. Feeding out of unsanitary bowls could cause the dogs to 
become ill and affect their health. Food receptacles must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks. 
*****Correct by March 22, 2021 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

End Section
